english_translation: First path: Ubayd ibn Umair al-Laithi related: Ababil means the birds following one another, they came out from the sea, appearing like the forms of men of Hind, black, with them stones, the greatest of them like camels without teeth (old), and the smallest of them like heads of men, they did not desire anything except they hit it, and they did not hit anyone except they killed him. Second path: Mujahid said: They are the Anqa (mythical bird)

english_translation: Regarding His saying: 'Those who are heedless of their prayer' [Surah al-Ma'un, verse 5], (Mus'ab) said: I asked my father and said: Is it the distraction one of us has, talking to himself in his prayer? He said: No, all of us talk to ourselves in prayer, but it is heedlessness of it: abandoning its proper time.

english_translation: When (the verse) 'Those who are heedless of their prayer' was revealed, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: 'Allah is the Greatest! This verse is better for you than if each one of you were given the equivalent of the entire world. He is the one who, if he prays, does not hope for good from his prayer, and if he abandons it, does not fear his Lord.'
